intro: Geranium sessiliflorum var. acaule, commonly known as the dwarf geranium, is a compact, low-growing perennial plant native to southern Africa. It features small, rounded leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive texture. The plant produces clusters of five-petaled flowers in shades of pink, red, and white, typically blooming from spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and containers. Its compact size and ornamental flowers make it a valuable addition to both garden and landscape design.
